name: Viconia DeVir - The Drow Cleric - Cleric 38 / Monk 1 / Assassin 1
author: Maximillian_Kane

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Mighty ECBers!

I know, I'm going through a bit of a Baldur's Gate frenzy at the moment, but in my defense, I've already had some of these builds in my hard drive for a very long time. This one, however, is a different story. I had a build for Viconia, but it was a completely different one, spawned mostly from my ignorance about her, since I never actually took her along for the ride, so I only had the information of when we crossed paths during my travels. I know she used to walk around hooded, to avoid being seen, because of how people in general reacted to the fact she was a Drow. And she was Evil, so I made her an Assassin spellsword with Cleric for buffs and Monk for Kama. Then, after talking to @Stagmeister , who used to take her along in his party, I got the feedback that the build didn't suit her, because according to him she was the best caster Cleric in the game. I thought, hmmm.. I have built arguably the best casting Cleric in NwN, so how about making an Evil version of my Demolition Man for her?

Assassin still makes sense to me, since it represents that she tries to conceal her identity and she's Evil. Monk represents her break from the Chaos of Lolth to follow a new faith and her discipline of staying true to her new cause. And Cleric because, well, she was a Pure Cleric in the game. Powergaming-wise, Monk gives her WIS AC, Tumble, Evasion and a skill dump, to allow her to get the requirements for Assassin, whereas Assassin gives her access to UMD and rounds up her Listen score. Nothing too much, because with 38 levels of Cleric and 14 INT, skill points aren't exactly in abundance. In this interpretation, because of NWN class-alignment restrictions, she has to be Lawful Evil.

Without further ado, Viconia DeVir!
